title: The chill coalition: A key regulatory node connecting salicylic acid and brassinosteroids in freezing tolerance
content: When discussing adverse environmental conditions, our minds often gravitate toward heat, given its direct impact on our comfort and well-being. Also, we typically have means to address cold temperatures, such as warm clothing and heating systems, reducing its impact on our daily life. However, for plants, coping with both extremes represents a challenge. They must adapt their physiology to withstand fluctuations in temperature, requiring them to employ intricate mechanisms to cope with their environmental conditions. Although plants can tolerate a certain range of temperatures, significant fluctuations, such as freezing, can have a profound impact on crop yield (Thakur et al. 2010).
